intro: Richardia scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, it thrives in sandy or rocky soils.
